intro: Pseudomertensia drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's mertensia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs. Pseudomertensia drummondii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
